indexterm.primary: RogueCity Solution Build - Quick Start Guide

section.title: What Changed
section.para: Your project has been refactored to use a Visual Studio solution (build_vs/RogueCities.sln) generated by CMake. This provides better integration with Visual Studio and organized project structure.

section.title: Solution Structure
section.para: The solution contains these key projects:

listitem.para: RogueCityCore - Core library (data types, math)
RogueCityGenerators - Procedural generation algorithms
RogueCityApp - Application layer (HFSM, integration)
RogueCityAI - AI assistant integration
RogueCityImGui - ImGui library wrapper
RogueCityVisualizerGui ? - Main GUI application (your startup project)
RogueCityVisualizerHeadless - Headless version
Test projects (test_core, test_generators, test_editor_hfsm, etc.)

section.title: Output Location
section.para: Built executables are now in: bin/RogueCityVisualizerGui.exe

section.title: Option 1: Visual Studio (Recommended)

literallayout.computeroutput: # Open the solution in Visual Studio start build_vs\RogueCities.sln

section.para:
Then:
Set RogueCityVisualizerGui as startup project (right-click ? Set as Startup Project)
Select Release or Debug configuration
Press F5 to build and run

literallayout.computeroutput:
# Build cmake --build build_vs --target RogueCityVisualizerGui --config Release --parallel 4
# Run .\bin\RogueCityVisualizerGui.exe

section.title: Geometry Migration Flags
section.para: The build now supports dual geometry backend flags for incremental migration:

literallayout.computeroutput:
# Legacy path (GEOS if available, otherwise legacy shim) cmake -B build_vs -S . -DUSE_LEGACY_GEOS=ON
# Boost.Geometry path (falls back to legacy shim if Boost is unavailable) cmake -B build_vs -S . -DUSE_LEGACY_GEOS=OFF

section.para: Recommended vcpkg install command for migration dependencies:

literallayout.computeroutput: vcpkg install boost-geometry fastnoise2 nanoflann delaunator-cpp
